metadata.title: CVE-2018-16845 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
nginx before versions 1.15.6, 1.14.1 has a vulnerability in thengx_http_mp4_module, which might allow an attacker to cause infinite loopin a worker process, cause a worker process crash, or might result inworker process memory disclosure by using a specially crafted mp4 file. Theissue only affects nginx if it is built with the ngx_http_mp4_module (themodule is not built by default) and the .mp4. directive is used in theconfiguration file. Further, the attack is only possible if an attacker isable to trigger processing of a specially crafted mp4 file with thengx_http_mp4_module.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16845` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
nginx-common - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
nginx-core - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
nginx-extras - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
nginx-full - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
nginx-light - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.3').
